org.matsim.contrib.socnetgen.sna.math

Class Distribution

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.matsim.contrib.socnetgen.sna.math.Distribution

  • public class Distribution
extends Object
    Representation of an empirical discrete distribution. Allows to apply weights to samples.
    Author:
    illenberger

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Distribution()
      Creates an empty distribution.
      Distribution(double[] values)
      Creates a distribution containing the values of values.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      gnu.trove.map.hash.TDoubleDoubleHashMap absoluteDistribution()
      Returns a histogram of all samples.
      gnu.trove.map.hash.TDoubleDoubleHashMap absoluteDistribution(double binsize)
      Returns a histogram of all samples where samples are aggregated into bins of width binsize.
      gnu.trove.map.hash.TDoubleDoubleHashMap absoluteDistributionFixed(int minSize)
      Returns a histogram where samples are aggregated into bins where each bin contains approximately the same number of samples.
      gnu.trove.map.hash.TDoubleDoubleHashMap absoluteDistributionLog(double discretization, double base)
      Returns a histogram where samples are first discretized into equal size bins of width discretization and the further discretized into log-scaled bins.
      gnu.trove.map.hash.TDoubleDoubleHashMap absoluteDistributionLog10(double descretization)
      Returns a histogram of all samples where samples are aggregated into bins with logarithmically scaled width.
      gnu.trove.map.hash.TDoubleDoubleHashMap absoluteDistributionLog2(double descretization)
      Returns a histogram of all samples where samples are aggregated into bins with log2 scaled width.
      void add(double value)
      Adds a sample to the distribution (with weight 1.0).

      Add a weighted sample to the distribution.

      Adds all samples form vals to the distribution (with weight 1.0).
      void addAll(double[] vals, double[] wghts)
      Adds all samples from vals to the distribution weight with the weights in weights.
      double coefficientOfVariance()
      Returns the coefficient of variance.
      double[] getValues()
      Returns the set of samples.
      double[] getWeights()
      Returns the weights.
      double kurtosis()
      Returns the (weighted) kurtosis (not excess kurtosis) of all samples.
      double max()
      Returns the maximum value of all samples.
      double mean()
      Returns the (weighted) mean of all samples.
      static double meanSquareError(gnu.trove.map.hash.TDoubleDoubleHashMap estimation, gnu.trove.map.hash.TDoubleDoubleHashMap observation)
      Calculates the mean square error of two distributions.
      double min()
      Returns the minimum value of all samples.
      gnu.trove.map.hash.TDoubleDoubleHashMap normalizedDistribution()
      Returns a histogram of all samples where the values are normalized so that the sum of all samples equals one.
      gnu.trove.map.hash.TDoubleDoubleHashMap normalizedDistribution(double binsize)
      Returns a histogram of all samples where the values are first aggregated into bins of width binsize and then normalized so that the sum of all discretized samples equals one.
      gnu.trove.map.hash.TDoubleDoubleHashMap normalizedDistribution(gnu.trove.map.hash.TDoubleDoubleHashMap distr)
      Creates a normalized histogram out of any other histogram.
      double skewness()
      Returns the (weighted) skewness of all samples.
      double variance()
      Returns the (weighted) variance of all samples.

      • addAll

        public void addAll(double[] vals,
                   double[] wghts)
        Adds all samples from vals to the distribution weight with the weights in weights. Both arrays must have same length.
        Parameters:
        vals - a set of samples.
        wghts - the weights.

      • absoluteDistribution

        public gnu.trove.map.hash.TDoubleDoubleHashMap absoluteDistribution()
        Returns a histogram of all samples.
        Returns:
        a histogram of all samples.

      • absoluteDistribution

        public gnu.trove.map.hash.TDoubleDoubleHashMap absoluteDistribution(double binsize)
        Returns a histogram of all samples where samples are aggregated into bins of width binsize. The key of the bin is the upper bin border.
        Parameters:
        binsize - the width of bins.
        Returns:
        a histogram of all samples.

      • absoluteDistributionLog10

        public gnu.trove.map.hash.TDoubleDoubleHashMap absoluteDistributionLog10(double descretization)
        Returns a histogram of all samples where samples are aggregated into bins with logarithmically scaled width. The key of the bin is the upper bin border.
        Parameters:
        descretization - a constant to decretize samples before they are aggregated into log bins.
        Returns:
        a histogram of all samples.

      • absoluteDistributionLog2

        public gnu.trove.map.hash.TDoubleDoubleHashMap absoluteDistributionLog2(double descretization)
        Returns a histogram of all samples where samples are aggregated into bins with log2 scaled width. The key of the bin is the upper bin border.
        Parameters:
        descretization - a constant to discretize samples before they are aggregated into log bins.
        Returns:
        a histogram of all samples.

      • absoluteDistributionLog

        public gnu.trove.map.hash.TDoubleDoubleHashMap absoluteDistributionLog(double discretization,
                                                                       double base)
        Returns a histogram where samples are first discretized into equal size bins of width discretization and the further discretized into log-scaled bins.
        Parameters:
        discretization - bin width of equal size bins
        base - log base
        Returns:
        a histogram.

      • absoluteDistributionFixed

        public gnu.trove.map.hash.TDoubleDoubleHashMap absoluteDistributionFixed(int minSize)
        Returns a histogram where samples are aggregated into bins where each bin contains approximately the same number of samples.
        Parameters:
        minSize - the approximately number of samples per bin
        Returns:
        a histogram.

      • normalizedDistribution

        public gnu.trove.map.hash.TDoubleDoubleHashMap normalizedDistribution()
        Returns a histogram of all samples where the values are normalized so that the sum of all samples equals one.
        Returns:
        a normalized histogram of all samples.

      • normalizedDistribution

        public gnu.trove.map.hash.TDoubleDoubleHashMap normalizedDistribution(double binsize)
        Returns a histogram of all samples where the values are first aggregated into bins of width binsize and then normalized so that the sum of all discretized samples equals one.
        Returns:
        a normalized histogram of all samples.

      • normalizedDistribution

        public gnu.trove.map.hash.TDoubleDoubleHashMap normalizedDistribution(gnu.trove.map.hash.TDoubleDoubleHashMap distr)
        Creates a normalized histogram out of any other histogram.
        Parameters:
        distr - the source histogram.
        Returns:
        a normalized histogram.

      • writeHistogram

        public static void writeHistogram(gnu.trove.map.hash.TDoubleDoubleHashMap distr,
                                  String filename)
                           throws FileNotFoundException,
                                  IOException
        Writes a histogram as a TAB-separated file with two columns: the first column indicates the bin key (e.g. upper bin border), the second column displays the count/share values.
        Parameters:
        distr - a histogram.
        filename - the filename.
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException
        IOException

      • meanSquareError

        public static double meanSquareError(gnu.trove.map.hash.TDoubleDoubleHashMap estimation,
                                     gnu.trove.map.hash.TDoubleDoubleHashMap observation)
        Calculates the mean square error of two distributions.
        Parameters:
        estimation - the estimated distribution.
        observation - the observed distribution.
        Returns:
        the mean square error.
